entry.title: SAP BTE 1120: Document Header Information Processing and Customization
entry.content:
In SAP ERP and S/4HANA systems, different extension options are offered to make business processes flexible according to customer needs. One of these extension tools is the Business Transaction Events (BTE) structure.

BTE 1120 allows user-defined changes on the document header and items during FI document posting. With this structure, some fields of the document can be updated, changed, or replaced with a fixed value automatically depending on conditions.

BTE 1120 makes it possible to change some fields in BKPF (document header) and BSEG (document items) tables before the document is posted. SAP provides the example function module SAMPLE_INTERFACE_00001120 as a basis for this development.

With this structure, many scenarios can be done, for example:
üìåAssigning a fixed text to the document header reference text field (BKPF_SUBST-BKTXT)
üìåUpdating the value date of a document item (BSEG_SUBST-VALUT) depending on a condition
üìåChanging the line item text (BSEG_SUBST-SGTXT) for the customer
üìåAssigning a payment block key (BSEG_SUBST-ZLSPR) to a document item
üìåChanging fields like cost center or activity type according to business rules

Thanks to this exit, when customer documents are posted (for example FB70, F-28, F-32 etc.), you can change values, assign new ones, or manipulate indirect data line by line.

During document posting, the fields XBLNR1 and/or BKTXT in the document header can be replaced with a new field or changed with a fixed value. This allows you to make changes at the time of posting.

During document posting, the fields ZLSPR and/or VALUT in the document item can be replaced with a new field or changed with a fixed value. This makes it possible to modify them at the time of posting.

Application on a Live Scenario:
The user asked us the following:
In personnel expense postings, in the automatically created FI documents, the item text from the personnel line should also appear in all other lines. Also, when posting, the personnel customer code should be added at the beginning of this text. This process should not be done manually, it should work automatically.

This requirement can be done by writing code with BTE 1120. Below, I will explain how to do this.

  DATA: lv_sgtxt   TYPE bseg-sgtxt,
        lv_lƒ±fnr   TYPE bseg-lƒ±fnr,
        lv_found   TYPE abap_bool,
        ls_bseg    TYPE bseg,
        ls_bsegsub TYPE bseg_subst.
  DATA lv_tabix TYPE sy-tabix.

    READ TABLE t_bkpf INTO DATA(ls_bkpf) INDEX 1.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0 OR ls_bkpf-blart <> 'PG'.
    RETURN. " PG deƒüilse √ßƒ±k
  ENDIF.

  LOOP AT t_bseg INTO ls_bseg.
    IF ls_bseg-umskz = '1' AND ls_bseg-sgtxt IS NOT INITIAL.
      lv_sgtxt = ls_bseg-sgtxt.
      lv_lƒ±fnr = ls_bseg-lƒ±fnr.
      lv_found = abap_true.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
  
  IF lv_found = abap_true.
    LOOP AT t_bseg INTO ls_bseg.
      lv_tabix = sy-tabix.

      READ TABLE t_bsegsub INTO ls_bsegsub INDEX lv_tabix.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        CONCATENATE lv_lƒ±fnr lv_sgtxt INTO ls_bsegsub-sgtxt SEPARATED BY space.
        MODIFY t_bsegsub FROM ls_bsegsub INDEX lv_tabix.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.

After the 1120 development was completed, a unit test was done with the transaction code F-02 by entering a document. Before the posting was finished, the explanations entered in the text field were as follows.

Revision of the text field according to the customer‚Äôs request after posting.

In conclusion, BTE 1120 is a strong SAP enhancement point that allows field-level changes during the document creation process. It is especially used when field values in automatically created FI documents need to be replaced according to non-standard rules. Its ability to provide direct solutions for real-life requirements and remove manual intervention makes 1120 a frequently used method in SAP projects.

I hope my writing will be helpful to you.

Best Regards,

Abdullah Kaba

entry.title: Re: SAP EWM process codes and its language
entry.content:
Hello @GOWRISANKAR_EWM 

Process code descriptions are language dependent. They are stored in the /SCDL/TEXCODET table. You can translate the descriptions in the process codes configuration, SPRO: SCM Extended Warehouse Management -> Extended Warehouse Management -> Cross-Process Settings -> Delivery - Warehouse Request -> Process Codes -> Define Process Codes

I guess either your Z-process code descriptions are wrong or your custom EWM monitor node reads the descriptions incorrectly.

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Read Data from excel file using Rest API ABAP
entry.content: @benedict-torres For information, your code has a syntax error, because CL_RSDA_CSV_CONVERTER is of type "create private" so you can't use NEW (nor CREATE OBJECT). You may instantiate the class only by calling the method CL_RSDA_CSV_CONVERTER=>CREATE.

entry.title: What is SAP BTE 1120 and how is it used?
entry.content:
In SAP ERP and S/4HANA systems, different extension options are offered to make business processes flexible according to customer needs. One of these extension tools is the Business Transaction Events (BTE) structure.

BTE 1120 allows user-defined changes on the document header and items during FI document posting. With this structure, some fields of the document can be updated, changed, or replaced with a fixed value automatically depending on conditions.

BTE 1120 makes it possible to change some fields in BKPF (document header) and BSEG (document items) tables before the document is posted. SAP provides the example function module SAMPLE_INTERFACE_00001120 as a basis for this development.

With this structure, many scenarios can be done, for example:
üìåAssigning a fixed text to the document header reference text field (BKPF_SUBST-BKTXT)
üìåUpdating the value date of a document item (BSEG_SUBST-VALUT) depending on a condition
üìåChanging the line item text (BSEG_SUBST-SGTXT) for the customer
üìåAssigning a payment block key (BSEG_SUBST-ZLSPR) to a document item
üìåChanging fields like cost center or activity type according to business rules

Thanks to this exit, when customer documents are posted (for example FB70, F-28, F-32 etc.), you can change values, assign new ones, or manipulate indirect data line by line.

 

During document posting, the fields XBLNR1 and/or BKTXT in the document header can be replaced with a new field or changed with a fixed value. This allows you to make changes at the time of posting.

 

During document posting, the fields ZLSPR and/or VALUT in the document item can be replaced with a new field or changed with a fixed value. This makes it possible to modify them at the time of posting.

 

Application on a Live Scenario:
The user asked us the following:
In personnel expense postings, in the automatically created FI documents, the item text from the personnel line should also appear in all other lines. Also, when posting, the personnel customer code should be added at the beginning of this text. This process should not be done manually, it should work automatically.

This requirement can be done by writing code with BTE 1120. Below, I will explain how to do this.

 

  DATA: lv_sgtxt   TYPE bseg-sgtxt,
        lv_lƒ±fnr   TYPE bseg-lƒ±fnr,
        lv_found   TYPE abap_bool,
        ls_bseg    TYPE bseg,
        ls_bsegsub TYPE bseg_subst.
  DATA lv_tabix TYPE sy-tabix.

    READ TABLE t_bkpf INTO DATA(ls_bkpf) INDEX 1.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0 OR ls_bkpf-blart <> 'PG'.
    RETURN. " PG deƒüilse √ßƒ±k
  ENDIF.

  LOOP AT t_bseg INTO ls_bseg.
    IF ls_bseg-umskz = '1' AND ls_bseg-sgtxt IS NOT INITIAL.
      lv_sgtxt = ls_bseg-sgtxt.
      lv_lƒ±fnr = ls_bseg-lƒ±fnr.
      lv_found = abap_true.
      EXIT.
    ENDIF.
  ENDLOOP.
  
  IF lv_found = abap_true.
    LOOP AT t_bseg INTO ls_bseg.
      lv_tabix = sy-tabix.

      READ TABLE t_bsegsub INTO ls_bsegsub INDEX lv_tabix.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        CONCATENATE lv_lƒ±fnr lv_sgtxt INTO ls_bsegsub-sgtxt SEPARATED BY space.
        MODIFY t_bsegsub FROM ls_bsegsub INDEX lv_tabix.
      ENDIF.
    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.

After the 1120 development was completed, a unit test was done with the transaction code F-02 by entering a document. Before the posting was finished, the explanations entered in the text field were as follows.

Revision of the text field according to the customer‚Äôs request after posting.

 

In conclusion, BTE 1120 is a strong SAP enhancement point that allows field-level changes during the document creation process. It is especially used when field values in automatically created FI documents need to be replaced according to non-standard rules. Its ability to provide direct solutions for real-life requirements and remove manual intervention makes 1120 a frequently used method in SAP projects.

I hope my writing will be helpful to you.

Best Regards,

Abdullah Kaba

entry.title: Health checks on new ECC 6.0 EHP8 system
entry.content:
I'm busy with an up-to-date installation of ECC 6.0 EHP8 on Windows Server 2019 with SQL server 2014. For the stack I chose just SAP ECC and no addons. Right after SWPM finishes I pause SUM to do health checks on the SPS 1 system before proceeding with the updates.

When I run RSNTABCONSISTENCY/RSDDCHECK on all objects (both checks enabled), it finds hundreds of inconsistent objects. Is this normal and expected, or is there a problem with the installation?

I also noticed error LOAD_PROGRAM_TABLE_MISMATCH in each case in the Syslog right after SWPM completes.

I've tried kernels 7.53 and 7.54 on SQL 2014, and I've tried kernel 7.54 with SQL 2017. All these scenarios seem to find the same inconsistent objects, so the problem doesn't seem to be with kernel or DB compatibility. SQL 2014 is the highest version that is fully compatible with the SPS1 stack that SWPM deploys at first.

Do these errors indicate a failed installation? SWPM never shows any errors and reports a successful installation. Are there any other health checks I can run other than SICK and missing objects in DB02?

entry.title: Re: Streamlining Local App Previews: Virtual Endpoints for Seamless Development
entry.content:
@jameswood32 sorry for the late reply üôè

if you want to try it yourself, you can find my personal github playground repository at https://github.com/heimwege/cap-node-fe-ts-sample (CAP node, OData v4, Fiori elements, Typescript).

Assuming you use the open source package @sap-ux/preview-middleware the minimal configuration in the UI5 yaml configuration is as easy as

server:
  customMiddleware:
  - name: preview-middleware
    afterMiddleware: compression

In case you don't want to go with the defaults or want to enable additional features, you can adjust it.

This middleware replaces the local html files with virtual endpoints. Everything you needed for a local preview with the static html files (for example using the fiori-tools-proxy for backend connection) will still be needed.

Do you have additional ideas on how to improve? You can reach out to us at https://github.com/SAP/open-ux-tools/issues.

entry.title: Re: SAP project system
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information () solves your issue?

To change the warning message to an error message in the SAP project system, specifically in the CJ20N screen for network activity person assignment, you can use Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) to implement custom logic. Business Logic Extensions for Enterprise Projects - SAP Community Here are the steps you can follow:

Steps to Implement Custom Logic

  1. Access SAP BAdI Implementation:

    • Go to the SAP GUI and enter the transaction code SE19 to access the BAdI implementation.

  2. Find Relevant BAdI:

    • Search for a BAdI that is related to project systems or network activities. You might need to consult SAP documentation or your SAP administrator to find the exact BAdI.

  3. Create Implementation:

    • Once you have identified the BAdI, create a new implementation.
    • In the implementation, write custom code to check the person assignment. If the person is not found, trigger an error message instead of a warning.

  4. Custom Error Message:

    • You can define custom error messages using the ‚ÄòCustom Reusable Elements‚Äô app in SAP.
    • Create a custom code list and use it in your BAdI implementation to display the error message.

  5. Test the Implementation:

    • After implementing the BAdI, test it in the CJ20N screen to ensure that the error message is displayed correctly when an incorrect employee name is entered.

Example Code

Here is a sample code snippet that you might use in your BAdI implementation:

IF person_not_found.
  LS_VALIDATIONMESSAGE-SYSTEMMESSAGETYPE = 'E'.
  LS_VALIDATIONMESSAGE-SYSTEMMESSAGENUMBER = '000'.
  LS_VALIDATIONMESSAGE-SYSTEMMESSAGEVARIABLE1 = 'Person not found. Please enter a valid employee name.'.
  APPEND LS_VALIDATIONMESSAGE TO VALIDATIONMESSAGES.
ENDIF.

This approach allows you to enforce stricter validation rules and ensure that users input correct employee names in the person assignment tab.

[1] Business Logic Extensions for Enterprise Projects - SAP Community

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Unable to edit ABAP Language version of a database ta...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content.) solves your issue?

To change the ABAP language version of an object in ADT, you typically need to access the properties of the object and modify the language version setting. However, if the field is not input-enabled, it might be due to restrictions in the system or the specific version of ADT you are using.

Steps to Change ABAP Language Version:

  1. Check Permissions: Ensure you have the necessary permissions to make changes. The authorization object S_ABPLNGVS 3303363 - You are not authorized to make changes (authorization object S_ABPLNGVS) might be required for making changes to language versions.
  2. Use ADT: Open the object in ADT, navigate to the Properties tab, and look for the ABAP language version setting ABAP Language Versions - FAQs - SAP Community under the General tab.
  3. Software Component: Ensure the software component is correctly set to ‚ÄòABAP for Cloud‚Äô. This might affect the ability to change the language version.

Considerations for Keeping Standard ABAP:

  • Compatibility: Keeping the language version as Standard ABAP in a Tier 1 package might lead to compatibility issues if the package is intended for cloud development.
  • Syntax Checks: Objects with Standard ABAP might not undergo the strict syntax checks enforced by the ABAP for Cloud Development version, potentially leading to issues in cloud environments.

If you are unable to change the language version due to system restrictions, it might be advisable to recreate the object in a package with the correct settings or consult SAP support for further assistance.

[1] 3303363 - You are not authorized to make changes (authorization object S_ABPLNGVS)
[2] ABAP Language Versions - FAQs - SAP Community

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: SAP S/4HANA Cloud for group reporting - Release 2508 is generally available
entry.content:
We‚Äôre continuing our strategic investment in group reporting to simplify financial closing, enhance user experience, and accelerate your consolidation process. Today, we‚Äôre pleased to announce the release of SAP S/4HANA Cloud for group reporting version 2508 launched on August 18, 2025. This latest release introduces powerful new features and integrates business AI capabilities into your software.

Key new and enhanced features in 2508 include:

  • Integration of Joule, our AI copilot, in group reporting
  • AI-assisted insights for group financial statement review booklet
  • Integration with SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC)
  • New consolidation auto post rules engine app
  • One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor app
  • Customer-defined sign convention
  • Accountant-friendly display of manual journal entries in debit-credit
  • Integration of balance validations and notifications in GRDC package
  • Export questions and answers from GRDC forms
  • Ability to enter or load reported data for dimension totals
  • Cross-version validations and dynamic version comparison in analytics
  • And many more improvements on data collection, data quality, analytics and master data

Download our feature deck.

-
Integration of Joule, our AI copilot, in Group Reporting

Joule is SAP‚Äôs AI copilot - leveraging its generative AI capabilities, Joule aims to understand your requests, retrieve information, and complete your tasks in a conversational way. For example, instead of manually navigating to a feature or page buried deep, you can describe the current task to Joule, who can help automate tasks or take you to places where you can find desired data. By using Joule, you can easily interact with the system and increase your productivity.

Group Reporting now integrates with two Joule capabilities.

Since June 2025, Group Reporting integrates with Joule's informational capability. This conversational search capability helps you retrieve necessary information from the SAP Help Portal or documents uploaded to the Joule service if you've set up Document Grounding. Joule searches available Group Reporting documentation and it's own knowledge base to find the answer to your query and summarizes the search results and provides the summarization as the answer to your question, along with the top three search results.

 

 

 

 

Released in version 2508, Joule‚Äôs navigational capability is now integrated in Group Reporting. This capability helps you find and navigate to the Group Reporting functionality or apps you're looking for without having to go through multiple links to reach a destination. ‚ÄãWith Joule, you can easily navigate across Group Reporting with navigational interactions. ‚ÄãJoule offers a navigational link that opens the relevant app and interface in a new browser tab. At the destination, you can continue from where you left off, with your previous conversation history.

Below is an example of navigation with Joule in Group Reporting. You're finished working on exchange rates (1), and tell Joule you'd "like to see group journal entry" (2) . Our AI copilot proposes three possible apps either to post or display journal entries. As you want to create a new journal entry, you just select the Post Group Journal Entries app and (3) Joule opens it.

More information: Joule informational capability, Document grounding, Joule navigational capability

-
AI-assisted insights for group financial statement review booklet

With version 2508, you can now use AI-generated analyses and summaries of your data in the Group Financial Statements Review Booklet app. You can use AI-assisted business insights for the Profit & Loss (nature of expense) and access it in the side panel. Based on the data displayed, you can do the following AI-assisted analyses: bottom-line growth, EBIT, EBITDA, financial result, operating income/loss, profitability, top-line growth and currency variance.

Business insights combine drilldown and filter actions with AI prompts, accessing large language model in SAP Business Technology Platform. They automate navigation and provide you with explanations of the data. Business insights answer predefined business questions and provides you with summarized information on your financial statements, including comments.

More information: AI-Assisted Business Insights in 'Group Financial Statements Review Booklet' App

-
Integration with SAP Business Data Cloud

SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) leverages our extensive portfolio of business applications and our customers‚Äô diverse data architectures to create a unified, semantically rich data environment built on a single semantic model. This environment serves as the data foundation for our AI-First strategy and is planned to become the preferred gateway for customers to extract data from SAP and non-SAP systems.

As depicted in the diagram below, in addition to the integration with BDC Analytics Cloud, in 2025 we strengthened Group Reporting integration with BDC by delivering content for Datasphere and integrating Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) with Datasphere.

 

Delivered in Q1-2025, the Group Reporting content in Datasphere allows to perform reporting on consolidated data within BDC. The content package includes the following (see screenshot below):

  • Extraction of Group Reporting master data
  • Extraction of Group Reporting raw transactional data
  • Group Reporting logic built in SAP Datasphere

The data model is implemented based on the data structures used in Group Reporting and leverages standard CDS views to extract and load data. It covers among others version relations including extension versions, group derivation logic based on group structure as well as hierarchy elimination. With the help of this content package, you can integrate your Group Reporting data with other data sets within Datasphere. Please note the reporting items and reporting rules are not yet be part of the content. We plan to remove this restriction together with this related innovation on reporting rules.

In September 2025 with version 2508.2, we'll deliver BDC integration in Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC). With this new feature, you can use Datasphere as a source in your data mapping definition. You have the ability to load data from Datasphere into Group Reporting with GRDC mapping. You can define new sources for Datasphere models, and use defined sources in GRDC. 

More information: Group Reporting content in Datasphere, Datasphere integration in GRDC

-
New consolidation auto post rules engine

You now benefit from a new rule engine to automate your consolidation postings. This engine is inspired by SAP Financial Consolidation and aims to offer the same level of power and flexibility valued by its users. 

We increased flexibility of the rule definition compared to existing consolidation rules:

  • Flexible definition of source data
  • Assignment of multiple document types in one task
  • Multiple posting lines
  • Flexible definition of the target data (field assignment, value calculation)
  • Inclusion of the results of previous rule steps as an option
  • Enhanced partner filter for intra-unit eliminations
  • Field Assignment option Value Of to post on partner fields
  • Inclusion of Rules to Nodes and Rule Groups
  • Flexible assignment of Rule Groups to the Tasks
  • Modern Task Log

Since June 2025, you can leverage our new rule engine to automate postings for consolidation units for local close (posting levels 00, 0C, 01, 10). Check out here for more information.

With version 2508, you can now also use our new rule engine to automate inter-unit eliminations for pairwise elimination (posting level 20). This feature enables you to automatically post group journal entries for pairs of consolidation units by running consolidation tasks in the consolidation monitor. It allows you to eliminate intercompany transactions, such as sales, other income/expenses, and accounts receivable/accounts payable, for example. 

As we move forward in 2025, we plan to release incremental innovations to automate consolidation group‚Äìrelated postings in the consolidation monitor on posting level 30, and replace reclassifications on posting level 30 (see our roadmap). 

More information:

  • Manage Rules for Automatic Postings
  • Assign Rule Groups for Automatic Postings
  • Display Logs for Automatic Postings
  • Import/Export Current Settings
  • Automatic Postings for Pairs of Consolidation Units
  • Automate consolidation group‚Äìrelated postings | SAP Roadmap 

-
One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor app

Available since June 2025, we deliver a new version of the Consolidation Monitor. You can now work in a modern user interface powered by the latest Fiori technology, including features like filtering and sorting.

To enhance your closing process experience, you're able to perform several actions with just one click ‚Äì for example, you can carry out a full consolidation or open and close periods effortlessly (see the screenshot below). You can improve usability by switching from the existing app to this new version with its updated interface. You're able to increase efficiency by performing actions across multiple values, including tasks, groups, and periods. Additionally, you can streamline operations by opening or closing multiple periods, running full consolidations, and automating task processing through task scheduling.

More information: One-click consolidation in a new consolidation monitor app

-
Customer-defined sign convention

From 2508.1 release, planned in September 2025, you'll be able to define your own sign logic, instead of the SAP sign logic. The SAP sign logic interprets positive amounts for each financial statement item as debit amounts and negative amounts as credit amounts. For instance, revenue is stored as a negative amount. With 2508.1, you can specify if the financial statement items should be posted as debit amounts or credit amounts.

‚ÄãYou can select the default sign behavior of your financial statement items:

  • Debit item: a positive number is a debit
  • Credit item: a positive number is a credit

For example, you can opt for the following sign convention:

  • Assets are debit financial statement items: gross values are entered as positive amounts; amortization, depreciation and impairment are entered as negative amounts
  • Equity & liabilities are credit: amounts are entered as positive amounts
  • Income statement are credit: revenues are entered as positive amounts, expenses as negative amounts

In this example, the movements (subitems) behave as follows:

  • Assets /Gross values and Equity & Liabilities: increases are entered as positive amounts, decreases
    as negative amounts
  • Assets /Amort. Depr. & Impairment: increases are entered as negative amounts, decreases as positive
    amount

More information: Configurable sign convention for data inputs and data processing  

-
Accountant-friendly display of manual journal entries in debit-credit

Available since June 2025, we enhanced the usability of the "Post Group Journal Entries" app. You can choose to enter manual group journals with a Debit/Credit indicator and sign-free amounts. When you activate this new layout, the manual journal entry is more accountant-oriented. This new feature changes only the display of the journals; it doesn‚Äôt change the way they're stored in the database. It's also applied to previously posted journals.

More information: Debit/Credit Indicator in the Manual Group Journal Entries Apps 

-
Integration of balance validations and notifications in GRDC package

We continue to deliver on the integration of the Data Monitor capabilities in Group Reporting Data Collection (GRDC) package. In addition to the integration of the release, data collection, annual net income and line validation tasks, in 2508 you can now benefit from the balance validation task integration in your package. With this integration, you're able to control the consistency of your consolidation unit reported data directly in the package.

Typical balance validations in GRDC include:

  • Assets equal Equity and Liabilities
  • Gross value of assets higher or equal to depreciation and impairment
  • Exhaustive breakdown of investment in subsidiaries by shares
  • Complete analysis of investment in subsidiaries, net equity or assets and liabilities by movements

You can use balance validations effectively in a staggered consolidation approach, where you use GRDC to collect data step by step in a phased manner. You define multiple data entry steps within a package. Each step targets a specific type of data and validations (like P&L, Balance Sheet, Intercompany, or Disclosures) and you're able to schedule them in a specific order. This lets you validate and complete each phase before moving to the next, ensuring data quality and control throughout the close process.

In addition, you can now receive notifications for the tasks you run for a package in the GRDC Enter Package Data app. These notifications keep you informed about the status and progress of your tasks, for example, reported data validation task. The task can be underway or completed successfully, with warning or with errors (see screenshot below).

More information: GRDC - Integrate balance validation task into the package, and receive notifications 

-
Export questions and answers from GRDC forms

In 2508.2, you'll be able to export all Q&A and text entered in GRDC Forms via the new Export Questions and Answers app.

When you add questions to your Forms, you collect additional textual information that becomes part of the financial data submitted to the Group. With the new Export Q&A to CSV function, you can easily extract all responses and use them for deeper insights, reporting, or decision-making. This makes it easier for you to work with qualitative data alongside your financial results.

Exporting Q&A is simple. Just follow these steps:

  1. Open the Export Package Data app.
  2. Use the filters at the top to select the Package you want to export.
  3. Click the Create QA Export button. You‚Äôll see the progress in the task list.
  4. Once the task is finished, a Download button will appear.
  5. Click the Download button to save the CSV file directly to your desktop.

More information: Export Q&A from GRDC

-
Ability to enter or load reported data for dimension totals

With version 2508, when you upload data (using the GRDC Data Mapping or Import Reported Data apps) or when you input data manually (in the GRDC Enter Package Data app) you can now choose to activate the Total Mode option to load reported data with some missing dimension values. The total value of such a dimension is then aggregated without changing the existing values of the same dimension.

For example, this new feature helps you to load a provisional balance sheet without breaking it down into subitems that can contain the details of a functional transaction type. The balance carry forward has already filled the opening subitem and this value will not change when the balance sheet is loaded. Instead, the delta is calculated and saved in a standard transaction type.

Here's an example of how you can load data using the new Total Mode option - here, in GRDC Data Mapping.

(1) On the opening balance, consolidation unit "CU001 - France" has a detail of 500 ‚Ç¨ on partner "CU002 - Germany" for the financial item 121190 - Trade receivables.

(2) Intercompany on Trade receivables is now 700 ‚Ç¨, and is imported with GRDC Data Mapping.

(3) With the Total Mode option, 200 ‚Ç¨ is automatically stored on the variation movement.

The uploaded amount of 700 is handled as a total. A delta amount of 200 between the uploaded amount of 700 on subitem 915 and the already present amount of 500 on subitem 900 is written to subitem 915 for FS item 121190 and partner CU002.

More information: Create Totals for Reported Data with Missing Dimension Values

-
Other innovations

Master data

  • Customer changes of SAP pre-defined selection objects are now supported
  • Parent method change in the Manage Group Structure app for activity-based consolidation of investments

Data collection

  • Multi-tab management in GRDC package
  • Decimal places for quantities based on unit of measure in GRDC package
  • New sign convention in data source import option of GRDC data mapping to adhere to customer sign convention
  • Enhanced documentation for changed treatment of product group in the release universal journal

Data quality and governance

  • New user roles to refine modification and access rights on GRDC data mapping definitions and jobs
  • Ability to generate/save a traceability log for each unique data mapping context in GRDC data mapping
  • New option to overwrite rule control level in line-item validations 
  • Automation of data collection control via control fields substitution in the activity-based consolidation of investments 

Analytics

  • Cross-version validations and dynamic version comparison in analytics

-
More information

  • Group reporting 2508 feature deck
  • Group reporting 2508 help portal
  • Recap of group reporting new features
  • Group reporting community
  • Group reporting customer influence platform

To resolve issues with Business Data Configuration (BDC) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, it is important to follow best practices and utilize available resources effectively. Here are some steps you can take:

1. Understand the Configuration Environment

Ensure you are familiar with the SAP Central Business Configuration tool, which is used for managing configurations centrally. This tool requires specific steps for user setup and access, which are crucial for avoiding access issues.

2. Follow Best Practices

SAP provides guidance on user setup and access, Avoid access issues during the initial set up of SAP Central Business which includes:

  • Configuring the Subject Name Identifier for Logon
  • Running Jobs for Pushing Roles
  • Creating Business Users and Providing Access Rights
  • Running Jobs for User Provisioning
  • Enabling Business Users to Access the SAP Central Business Configuration Tenant

3. Utilize Available Documentation

Refer to SAP‚Äôs help documentation and blogs for detailed instructions on setting up and managing configurations. This includes understanding the architecture and authentication processes involved.

4. Address Common Issues

Be aware of common issues such as session expiration or unauthorized access, and follow the recommended steps to resolve them. This may involve checking identity provisioning settings or ensuring correct user role assignments.

5. Seek Support

If issues persist, consider reaching out to SAP support for assistance. They can provide guidance specific to your configuration environment and help resolve complex issues.

By following these steps, you can effectively manage and resolve issues related to BDC in SAP S/4HANA Cloud.

entry.title: Re: but why its not updating in standard table by staging...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

The issue of data not updating in the standard table from the staging table in SAP S/4HANA could be due to several reasons:

  1. Duplicate Entries: If there is an existing record with the same key fields in the staging table, the system will not insert the new data, resulting in an error message indicating that the instance already exists. You need to delete the existing record in the staging table before uploading the new data. See more details on this issue.

  2. Freeze Triggers: During the data transfer process, staging tables are locked using freeze triggers to prevent changes. If these triggers are active, you cannot insert new data into the staging tables. You can resolve this by finishing the transfer or restarting the transfer process to unlock the tables.

  3. Data Validation Issues: If the data in the staging table does not meet the required format or contains errors, the system will not transfer it to the standard table. Ensure that all mandatory fields are correctly populated and that the data types match the expected formats.

  4. System Configuration: Ensure that the system is configured correctly for data migration, including the setup of database connections and communication scenarios.

  5. Transport Mechanism: If you are using the transport functionality, ensure that the project and migration objects are correctly added to the transport request and that the system settings allow for modifications.

If these issues persist, reviewing the detailed logs and error messages in the SAP 3072123 - Transfer of data to staging table failed in Migrate Your Data app S/4HANA migration cockpit can provide more insights into the specific problem.

[1] 3072123 - Transfer of data to staging table failed in Migrate Your Data app

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: CAT2 is showing error message
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

The error message KL001 in CAT2 might be related to issues with the assignment between cost centers and activity types. Even though you have checked KP26 and found entries for the cost center and activity type, there could be other underlying issues causing this error.

Steps to Investigate:

  1. Check Cost Center Validity: Ensure that the cost center is valid for the period you are trying to post. Sometimes, validity periods can cause discrepancies.

  2. Activity Type Assignment: Verify that the activity type is correctly assigned to the cost center. 3108513 - CR091 error when inputting activity type into Work Center This can be done using the app ‚ÄòManage Cost Rates - Plan‚Äô to ensure the link is established.

  3. Cost Center Category: Make sure the cost center category is compatible with the activity type. 2864151 - Cost Center Category for Activity Types in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Professional Services) You can check this in the app ‚ÄòManage Activity Types‚Äô.

  4. System Configuration: There might be configuration issues that need to be addressed. Ensure that all necessary configurations are correctly set up in the system.

If these steps do not resolve the issue, it might be helpful to consult with SAP support for further assistance.

Kind regards,

Henrike

 

[1] 3108513 - CR091 error when inputting activity type into Work Center
[2] 2864151 - Cost Center Category for Activity Types in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition (Professional Services)

entry.title: Re: How to Create MRP Area and mapping with Product mater...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

When you encounter an error while trying to map the MRP area in the product master management app, it could be due to several reasons. Here are some steps you can follow to resolve the issue:

  1. Check MRP Area Configuration: Ensure that the MRP area is correctly configured in the system. The MRP area should be defined properly with the correct plant and MRP controller combinations.

  2. Automatic Creation of MRP Area: In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, the plant MRP area is created automatically 3350626 - Error occurs when trying to create plant MRP area when you create the first material in the plant or the planning file entries for the plant. Ensure that this step has been completed.

  3. Consistency Check: Run a consistency check to ensure that the MRP area is correctly set up. Step by step process for storage location MRP in S‚Ä¶ - SAP Community You can use reports like MRP_AREA_STORAGE_LOC_MIGRATION to check for any missing configurations.

  4. Assign MRP Area in Material Master: Make sure that the MRP area is assigned in the MRP1 view in the material master. This includes maintaining the MRP type, MRP controller, and lot sizing procedures.

  5. Check for Duplicate MRP Areas: Ensure that there are no duplicate MRP areas maintained 3354210 - Error message ‚ÄòA row already exists with this key‚Äô shows up when posting goods issue for an outbound delivery for the same supplier and plant, as this can cause errors.

If these steps do not resolve the issue, you may need to consult with your SAP support team for further assistance.

[1] 3350626 - Error occurs when trying to create plant MRP area
[2] Step by step process for storage location MRP in S... - SAP Community
[3] 3354210 - Error message 'A row already exists with this key' shows up when posting goods issue for an outbound delivery

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Import excel service entry sheet with account assignm...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

When importing a service entry sheet using the Excel template, encountering the error message ‚ÄòService entry sheet Account item 00001: account assignment definition not allowed‚Äô can be frustrating. Here are some steps to help you resolve this issue:

  1. Check Account Assignment Category: Ensure that the account assignment category in your template matches the one used in the purchase order. If the purchase order has an unknown account assignment, you need to specify it in the template.

  2. Verify Mandatory Fields: Make sure all mandatory fields marked with an asterisk (*) in the template are correctly filled. This includes fields like ‚ÄòHeader ID‚Äô, ‚ÄòItem ID‚Äô, and ‚ÄòAcct Assmgt ID‚Äô.

  3. Review Conditional Fields: Some fields are conditionally required, marked with two asterisks (**). Ensure these are filled based on the conditions specified in the template instructions.

  4. Check for Multiple Account Assignments: If your purchase order allows multiple account assignments, ensure that the template reflects this by setting the ‚Äòhas multiple Account Assignments‚Äô field to TRUE.

  5. Format Consistency: Ensure that the format of the template matches the requirements, such as date formats (YYYYMMDD) and character limits.

  6. Consult the Help Portal: The SAP Help Portal provides detailed instructions Example: Importing Service Entry Sheets from Microsoft Excel Files on how to fill the template correctly. Double-check your entries against these guidelines.

If you continue to face issues, consider checking the app ‚ÄòMonitor Service Entry Sheet Generation Log‚Äô for more detailed error messages that might help pinpoint the problem.

[1] Example: Importing Service Entry Sheets from Microsoft Excel Files

Kind regards,

Henrike

The ‚ÄòInvoice Receipt Date‚Äô field in the Create Supplier Invoice application is a new addition that can affect various aspects of invoice processing. Here are some potential impacts:

  1. Tax Calculation: The receipt date might be used to determine the applicable tax rates if time-dependent taxes are active. This can influence the tax determination process.

  2. Exchange Rate Determination: The receipt date could be used as a reference for determining exchange rates, especially if the translation date differs from the posting date.

  3. Workflow and Approval Processes: Changes to the ‚ÄòInvoice Receipt Date‚Äô might trigger workflow processes, especially if the date is relevant for approval conditions.

  4. Reporting and Analytics: The receipt date can be used in procurement analytics to track and report on invoice processing timelines.

  5. Compliance and Audit: Accurate recording of the receipt date is crucial for compliance and audit purposes, ensuring that invoices are processed within the stipulated time frames.

Overall, the ‚ÄòInvoice Receipt Date‚Äô field adds an additional layer of detail that can enhance the accuracy and efficiency of supplier invoice management.

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Link of Subcon Challan with PO in S/4HANA public cloud
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

To print the Purchase Order (PO) number on the subcontracting challan PDF output in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, you need to ensure that the PO number is mapped correctly in the form template used for the challan. Here are the steps you can follow:

Steps to Map PO Number to Challan

  1. Access Form Templates: S/4HANA Cloud Output Management - Purchase Order - SAP Community Use the ‚ÄòMaintain Form Templates‚Äô app to access the form template used for the subcontracting challan.

  2. Download and Edit Template: Download the template and open it in Adobe LiveCycle Designer. You can find the template by searching for the relevant form name in the ‚ÄòPredelivered Templates‚Äô tab.

  3. Add PO Number Field: In the Data View tab of Adobe LiveCycle Designer, locate the field for the PO number. If it is not present, you may need to add it as a custom field.

  4. Link PO Number with Challan: Ensure that the PO number field is linked to the correct data source in the form template. This might involve using a CDS view that contains both the PO number and the challan number.

CDS Views and Fields

To link the PO number with the challan number, you can use CDS views that contain procurement and subcontracting data. You might need to create a custom CDS view if the standard ones do not meet your requirements.

  • CDS View for Procurement: Look for CDS views related to procurement documents that include fields like PurchaseOrder and ChallanNumber.
  • Custom Fields: If necessary, create custom fields using the ‚ÄòCustom Fields and Logic‚Äô app to ensure the PO number is available in the form template.

Additional Resources

  • SAP Community Blogs: Check SAP Community blogs for detailed guides on form template customization and CDS view creation.
  • SAP Help Portal: Refer to the SAP Help Portal for documentation on subcontracting processes and form template management.

By following these steps, you should be able to map the PO number to the subcontracting challan India - Create Subcontracting Challan or Invoice and print it on the PDF output.

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Create Supplier Invoice - Invoice Receipt Date
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

The ‚ÄòInvoice Receipt Date‚Äô field in the Create Supplier Invoice application is a new addition that can impact how supplier invoices are processed and recorded. This field is likely used to capture the date on which the invoice was received by the company, which can be crucial for tracking payment timelines and compliance with payment terms.

Potential Impacts:

  • Payment Processing: The receipt date can affect the calculation of payment due dates, especially if payment terms are based on the receipt of the invoice rather than the invoice date.
  • Compliance and Auditing: Having a clear record of when invoices are received can help in audits and ensure compliance with internal policies and external regulations.
  • Cash Flow Management: Accurate tracking of invoice receipt dates can aid in better cash flow management by providing insights into upcoming payment obligations.

Recommendations:

  • Review Internal Processes: Ensure that your internal processes for handling supplier invoices are updated to include the recording of the invoice receipt date.
  • Training: Provide training to staff involved in invoice processing to understand the importance of this field and how to use it effectively.

For more detailed information, you may need to consult specific SAP documentation or support resources related to the Create Supplier Invoice application.

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Can I write the one or Standard Unit Test for my all...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

ABAP Unit tests are a crucial part of ensuring the quality and reliability of your ABAP code. They allow you to test individual units of code, such as methods or classes, to verify that they work as expected.

Can You Write a Standard Unit Test for All ABAP Code?

While you can create unit tests for various parts of your ABAP code, it is not feasible to have a single standardized unit test for all your code. Each unit test is typically specific to the functionality of the code it is testing. Here are some key points to consider:

  • Specificity: Unit tests are designed to test specific functionalities or methods. They should be tailored to the logic and requirements of the code they are testing.
  • Reusability: While you cannot have one unit test for all code, you can create reusable test methods or classes that can be used across different unit tests.
  • Coverage: Aim for high test coverage by writing unit tests for all critical parts of your code. This helps in identifying issues early and ensures robustness.

Tools and Practices

  • ABAP Unit: This is the framework used for writing unit tests in ABAP. It supports writing and executing tests directly within the ABAP environment.
  • ABAP Test Cockpit (ATC): Use ATC for static code analysis to identify potential issues in your code.

For more detailed guidance, you can refer to resources on Unit Testing with ABAP Unit and Checking Quality of ABAP Code with ATC.

entry.title: Re: How to change Project Demand Name
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

When dealing with the redistribution of project work hours demand due to a cost center split, you have encountered two main challenges:

  1. Creating a New Demand:

    • The system does not allow multiple demands to be allocated to the same Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) R&D / Engineering - Resource Demand element and Activity Type. This is a limitation within the SAP S/4HANA Cloud system.

  2. Modifying Existing Demand:

    • You are unable to change the name of an existing demand. This is because once a demand is created, certain attributes, including the name, become fixed and cannot be altered.

Suggested Solutions

  • Modify Existing Demand:

    • Since you cannot create multiple demands for the same WBS and Activity Type, you should continue with modifying the existing demand. R&D / Engineering - Manage Project Demand While the name cannot be changed, you can adjust other attributes such as the planned effort, dates, and resource assignments.

  • Use External Staffing:

    • If you need more flexibility, consider using external staffing solutions. This allows for more dynamic management of resource demands, although it requires integration with external systems.

Additional Tips

  • Consult SAP Documentation:

    • For more detailed guidance, refer to the SAP documentation on managing project demands, which provides insights into demand attributes and statuses.

  • Contact SAP Support:

    • If these solutions do not resolve your issue, consider reaching out to SAP support for further assistance.

 

For more information, you can explore the SAP Community and SAP Help Portal for detailed guides and resources.

Kind regards,

Henrike

[2] R&D / Engineering - Manage Project Demand

entry.title: Re: SAP ByD connectivity with SAP IS and SAP DS
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

To profile and write rules on SAP ByD data using Information Steward, you can follow these steps:

Steps to Profile and Write Rules

  1. Data Extraction: First, ensure that you can extract the necessary data from SAP ByD. This might involve using SAP‚Äôs data extraction tools or APIs to get the data into a format that Information Steward can work with.

  2. Data Profiling: Use Information Steward to profile the data. This involves analyzing the data to understand its structure, quality, and any anomalies. Information Steward provides tools to assess data quality and identify issues such as duplicates, missing values, or incorrect formats.

  3. Rule Creation: Once the data is profiled, you can create rules in Information Steward. These rules can be used to validate data, enforce data quality standards, and transform data as needed. Rules can be based on business requirements and data quality standards.

  4. Data Transformation and Cleansing: Apply the rules to transform and cleanse the data. Information Steward allows you to automate these processes, ensuring that the data meets the required standards before migration.

  5. Monitoring and Reporting: Use Information Steward‚Äôs monitoring and reporting features to track data quality over time and ensure that the rules are being applied correctly.

Considerations

  • Ensure that you have the necessary access and permissions to extract data from SAP ByD.
  • Familiarize yourself with Information Steward‚Äôs capabilities and how they can be applied to your specific data migration needs.

If you need more detailed guidance or specific examples, consulting with an SAP expert or referring to SAP‚Äôs documentation on Information Steward might be beneficial.

Kind regards,

Henrike

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to display Custom Application Logs in...
entry.content:
Hello,

Thank you very much for your question and sorry for the late reply.

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) solves your issue?

To display custom application logs in SAP S/4HANA Cloud using a standard Fiori app, you can consider the following options:

  1. SAP Fiori App ‚ÄòDisplay Application Logs‚Äô (F1487): Manage Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition - Application Logs

    • This app is designed to display application logs and is available in the SAP Fiori Library. However, you mentioned difficulties in finding it within the IAM Information System. Ensure that the app is included in the correct business catalog and that you have the necessary authorizations.

  2. Freestyle App Integration: Developer Extensibility - Freestyle App Integration

    • You can create a freestyle app and integrate the application log display using the Fiori Reuse Library. This involves adapting your view definition and controller files to include the log display component. Although you have had challenges with reuse libraries before, this method provides a structured way to display logs.

  3. Custom Class CL_BALI_LOG_DB:

    • As you have already implemented, using a custom class to retrieve and display logs is a viable option. You can enhance this approach by creating a CDS Custom Entity to expose the logs in a more structured format.

  4. Creating a Custom Tile:

    • You attempted to create a custom tile pointing to the F1487 app intent. Ensure that you have the necessary authorizations and that the tile configuration is correct.

  5. Business Catalog and Authorization:

    • Verify the business catalog that contains the application logs tile and ensure that your user role includes this catalog. You may need to consult with your system administrator to adjust roles and authorizations.

For more detailed guidance on implementing the Fiori Reuse Library, you can refer to the documentation on Freestyle App Integration.

Kind regards,

Henrike

Hi Team,

Can someone please help me understand the difference between the two pieces of code below?

The first code snippet aggregates the Amount over Customer, GL Account, Plant, Profit Center, Quantity Unit, and Period, by assigning to a variable member #AMOUNT:

//Aggregate Amount over Customer, GL Account, Plant, Profit Center, Quantity Unit and Period
DATA([d/Measures] = #AMOUNT, [d/Date] = #DATE, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = "#", [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_PLANT] = "#", [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_CUSTOMER] = "#", [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_PROFITCENTER] = "#", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_QUANTITY_UNIT] = "#") =
RESULTLOOKUP([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT", [d/Version] = "public.Actual", [d/Date] = PREVIOUS(12))

This code produced the following lookup table (referred to as Lookup1), which contains 2 records.

I then wrote another statement as shown below, where I replaced the variable member #AMOUNT with the literal string "AMOUNT":
//Aggregate Amount over Customer, GL Account, Plant, Profit Center, Quantity Unit and Period
DATA([d/Measures] = "AMOUNT", [d/Date] = #DATE, [d/SAP_FI_IFP_GLACCOUNT] = "#", [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_PLANT] = "#", [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_CUSTOMER] = "#", [d/t.S:SAP_ALL_PROFITCENTER] = "#", [d/SAP_FI_IFP_QUANTITY_UNIT] = "#") =

entry.title: Re: The Authorization Required for "Manage Subscriptions"...
entry.content:
Hi Alex,

To enable the "Manage Subscriptions" option within the "Get Notified" tab of "SAP for Me,  an S-user must hold the role of either Super Administrator or Cloud Administrator. After reviewing your S-user ID, I can confirm that you are not currently assigned one of these roles, which is why the option is not visible to you. 

If you would like to become a Super or Cloud Administrator, you will need to reach out to your organization‚Äôs current Super or Cloud Administrator listed in https://me.sap.com/userscontacts/impcont to request the necessary authorizations. 

For more detailed information, please refer to KBA 2596214 - How to maintain Super, Cloud, and User Administrator S-user IDs listed in My Important Contacts - SAP for Me

  • To add a Super Administrator, an existing Super Administrator must provide all authorizations to another S-user ID. Tip: Follow KBA 1614304 to copy or clone their own authorizations.
  • To add a Cloud Administrator, an existing Cloud Administrator needs to provide the authorization "Display Cloud Data" at Installation Level.
    • To find more recommended authorizations to Cloud Administrator, see KBA 2198153.
    • Tip: See KBA 2916760 to understand what cloud admin authorizations do for users. 

If you have any questions or need further assistance, please feel free to contact us. 

Have a nice weekend!

Best regards,
SAP Support

entry.title: Use of Settlement Material in SAP S/4HANA Condition Contract
entry.content:
Overview

Entering a settlement material in a condition contract is optional. However, in scenarios such as those involving product groups, where multiple materials are assigned to a specific product group, it is more efficient to perform settlement using a ‚Äúsettlement material‚Äù rather than settling each individual material. In such cases, specifying a settlement material in the condition contract becomes necessary.

Key Process Consideration

The material will always be transferred from source document to settlement document if you are using a profile of business volume with a split criteria MATNR (material number). When creating a condition contract, you can enter a settlement material that represents a group of products. Then, when you run the final settlement, system uses this single reference instead of listing every product.

If you want system to use the settlement material instead of the actual product from the original document, you must do following additional settings:

# In split criteria for settlement of profile for BV determination change usage control to ‚Äú1: Is used ‚Äì Unless Deactivated via process variant‚Äù

 

# Create a new process variant & define a field MATNR in the split criteria and select ‚Äú1: Do not use as a split criterion‚Äù in usage as split criteria‚Äù.

Then, create the condition contract and enter the settlement material. define which product group it applies to in business volume selection criteria. Then run the settlement using transactions like WB2R_SC or WB2R_SV. The system will show the settlement material in the final document.

To get the best results make sure your product groups are well set up. Test your setup in a sandbox system to avoid issues. Use clear names for settlement materials so reports are easy to understand. Also, make sure your setup matches how your business tracks volumes and sales.

Using settlement material also helps simplify accounting because you don‚Äôt need a separate rule for each product. It makes reporting easier since you can track performance using one reference. You can even automate the selection of settlement materials to save time. And if business handles thousands of products, this feature can really speed things up.

Conclusion

Settlement material is a powerful tool in SAP S/4HANA that can make contract and settlement management much easier. It helps you work faster, stay organized & get clearer insights. With the right setup and testing  it can be a big help for both customer and vendor settlements.

Happy Learning!

entry.title: CREATING CAPM APPLICATION WITH NODE.JS BY USING S/4 HANA DATABASE - Part 2
entry.content:
Hello Buddies!!

Have you Subscribed to all our pre-requisites for the development?

No üò® !!!

Don't worry let's set it up. Follow the link below!!

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/creating-capm-application-with-node-js-by-using-s-4-hana-database/qaq-p/14204742

Welcome to next episode of CREATING CAPM APPLICATION WITH NODE.JS BY USING S/4 HANA DATABASE.

In this Episode Lets Create an Capm Application by Using a Template, So that deployment configurations will be added automatically without manual errors.

Step1: Click on the light = icon and select Project from Template > Cap Project. 

Step2: Click on next and Fill the details like Project name, Runtime environment. I named my project as zcapm_hanadb.

 

Click on Finish. Hurray our app gets generated in few seconds.

Note: Check whether you are subscribed to Hana cloud which is already there in prerequisites blog, We have also created a instance for that.

Now make sure your Hana db instance is running.

 

It would take around 10 to 15 minutes to get to running status.

Now let move to SAP BAS where our application got created.

Step3: Run the application as Right click on app> Open in integrated Terminal > Enter command CDS Watch, check whether all the node modules installed or not. Enter Command

npm install.

Step4: Next enter the command  npm install -g hana-cli. In this we are installing hana cloud Command line interface where we need to push our data into.

Now lets work on our Project before we connect with Data Base.

Step5: In folder structure under db >data-model.cds(I have re-named it on my own interest).Name should be filename.cds. 

Lets create our Structure, In this there should be one Unique key for every entity you have created.

Code:

namespace zcapm_hanadb;
entity Products {
      @title : 'Sales
Order Number'
    key id: Integer;
      @title : 'Product Name'
    name: String;
      @title : 'Price'
    price: Decimal;
      @title : 'Description'
    description: String;
      @title : 'Stock left'
    stock: Integer;
 
   
}
 

Step 6: In folder structure under srv >cat-service.cds(I have re-named it on my own interest).Name should be filename.cds. 

In this case lets declare our function calls for get and Post. Just function names are declared in this section where we are about to call them in another file.

Important Note: In defining the cds function please remember two main things,

a) function(Get Call)

b) action (Post Call)

Code: 

using zcapm_hanadb from '../db/data-model';

service CatalogService{
  entity Products as projection on zcapm_hanadb.Products;
  
  // get service call 
 function fnCatalogGetService(name: String) returns String;

 // Post service call 
action fnCreateRecord(id: Integer, name: String, price: Decimal, description:String, stock: Integer) returns String;
}

Step 7: In this let's create one more file under srv>cds-service.js (filename.js). 

In this file we will write our node js logic for functions we have declared in cat-service.cds.

Code: 

const cds = require('@sap/cds');
const {Products} = cds.entities('zcapm_hanadb');


module.exports = cds.service.impl(async function() {
   //Get call
this.on('fnCatalogGetService', async (req) => {
         const { name } = req.data;
 console.log(name, "Hello World");
// Post call
this.on('fnCreateRecord', async (req) => {
     const { id, name, price, description, stock } = req.data;
console.log("Hello World is working fine");

})
    
});

Now we have created our very basic structure of entity and has given a service name under it. In order to utilize our service lets deploy our app to S/4 Hana DB and call data from it.

Command: cds build (Find there any errors in the terminal)

 

command: cds watch (Run the app).

Note: If you found error message like in above image, then follow below steps.

a. First enter Ctrl + C (To End the process)

b.  Click = > View > Command Pallette.

Enter Stop port and select below one.

Once it is done, now again enter the cds watch. You will find the screen like below where you you can find your service.

Step 8:  Lets connect to our app to S/4 Hana DB.

On the top-left most corner  where our project we have opened, there when you minimize it you will find SAP HANA PROJECTS. Open them.

Step 9: Expand our project.

Step 10: Under Database Connections we can find the same project name.

Click on the Green socket symbol to bind our project to HDI container (i.e., Hana DB container).

  • Bind to an HDI container

  • Click on new service instance, it will suggest you a name(you can rename it or use it as it is)

 

Note: Make sure your Hana Cloud is running

 

 

On clicking on top of Database Connections click on bind all.

Next Click on Hana HD Container symbol which is on the top of project.

 

 

Mean while if you want to know what are all services got generated. Enter the command cf services

 

We can see our instance got reflected in sap BTP as well.

 

Application gets open here you can find your container with in built database with the instance we have created.

Step 11: Our service got binded in the HDI Container and let's deploy our app.

Click on the deploy icon under hana projects > your project.

Our deployment looks like below screen.

Under project > db you can observe all our hana database files got created.

Navigate to Hana db explorer, we see our app got deployed. Refresh the page.

 

 

As our structure is ready let‚Äôs add some data in it.

Step 12: Right click on your entity and select import data. Filename should be same as entity name which we have maintained in db>data-model.cds

File Data I Have Uploaded Here..

idnamepricedescriptionstock
1Widget A19.99A useful widget for various tasks100
2Widget B29.99An advanced widget with additional features50
3Widget C39.99A premium widget designed for expert users25

 

 

In Step3 it automatically reads the table from the data imported.

 

 

 

Once you click on Review, this looks like below

 

Click on import to database

 

Hurray we don‚Äôt have any errors and its successfully imported.

Now import it to our database table Review > Import data.

 

 

Now right click and click on Open Data. 

As our database is having the data now, we need to have scope to access it in our application.

Lets run the application command: cds watch --profile  hybrid.

Here after we will be using this command as will compile the runtime dependencies.

 

 

 

Error: Data is not loaded its fix it up!!!

We need to add the shared key access for the cloud foundry

Step 13: Go to btp cockpit and the service instance that we have created during deployment process, Copy it.

 

Copy the Bold letters as an Instance name and type in with the command in your app

Command: cds bind -2 <instanceName>:SharedDevKey   

 

 

Instance key also gets appeared on top of hana DB explorer.

Step 14: Next run cds watch --profile hybrid

Click on Products and Check your metadata is loaded or not.

Hurray!!! My data got loaded successfully.

References:

https://fioriappslibrary.hana.ondemand.com/sap/fix/externalViewer/

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/creating-capm-application-with-node-js-by-using-s-4-hana-database/qaq-p/14204742

https://help.sap.com/fiori_bs2013/helpdata/en/a7/1564526ba1f25fe10000000a423f68/content.htm?no_cache...

 
In Next Upcoming sessions let's perform CRUD Operations on our S/4 Hana Data Base for SAP Fiori app as a front end.


Hope it‚Äôs helpful üòä

Thanks,
Divya MANDAVA.

entry.title: Re: How to add a printer in the Account Document Output-C...
entry.content:
Hello @jason_su 

Thank you for your question.

In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, adding or configuring printers for apps like Account Document Output is handled differently from the traditional on-premise SAP systems. You typically cannot directly add printers via the app interface, as output devices are managed centrally and integrated with cloud printing services or external print management. However, there are steps to add or select a printer in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition:

First is to check for existing Output Devices in the printer selection popup as shown in your screenshot, you see a list of existing configured output devices. These devices are maintained centrally in the cloud tenant and usually cannot be created or modified within the app directly.

You also have the possibility to request Printer Registration via SAP Cloud Print Setup. Please note, for new printers to appear in the list, they must be registered and authorized through SAP Cloud Print or the Managed Print Service connected to your tenant and this involves coordination with your cloud basis or SAP support team to onboard new printer devices.

There is also the possibility to use Standard or PDF Export Devices to send your documents to PDF or export them. You can select predefined devices like DEVICE_FOR_PDF_EXPORT. For physical printer output, your SAP Cloud basis team must set up the printer routing.

For further details, Refer to SAP guidance on cloud print management and output device setup

I hope this provides the desired insights.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Enhancing Successfactors Alert Message With Images Through HTML
entry.content:
Scenario

With the scenario as ours in consideration where the business required an image and a footer on already existing birthday alert message for users company wide.

The scenarios might differ company wise or client wise but the very basic method or process of fulfilling this requirement remains the same widely.

Alert Message Configuration 

Here we will be discussing the pre-requisite and configurations required for a header and a footer for our system triggered alert message and possible issues along with their solutions that we might face post alert trigger.

Pre - Requisites

  • We should have admin rights on Successfactors preferably Manage Data and Alert Message permissions.
  • We should have a One Drive and Outlook access for uploading our header and footer and validating our email alert respectively.
  • Thirdly, we shall be able to host or upload the images which we want to use as a header and a footer for our alert message (in our case we have uploaded it on a One Drive folder) as we will be using the One Drive link of that picture in our HTML code.
  • We can also host the images online through free available tools and then use that link in our html.

Configuration 

  • Create an alert message as per your message content.
  • Use the below mentioned html code for the header/footer section where you want the pictures to appear in the alert message as per attached image.


<html>
<body>
<h2></h2>
<img src="Use The Link Within These Inverted Commas Mentioned In The Third Point Under Pre-Requisites Heading" width="100" height="50">
</body>
</html>‚Äã
  • Adjust the width and height as per your requirement.
  • Please note that if you want to include both header and footer (like in our case), the mentioned html code must be used separately first in the header area (where you want your header to appear) and then in the footer section (where you want your footer to appear) with the width/height adjustments as per the requirements.
  • We can also use below code for center alignment of the images,
<h2></h2>
<div style="text-align: center;">
<img src="Use The Link Within These Inverted Commas Mentioned In The Third Point Under Pre-Requisites Heading" width="500" height="333">
</div>‚Äã
  • Now initiate the alert message and check your email for your required header and footer.

Incase we receive an email with below attached error in your header/footer or in an image. The possible reasons might be,

  1. We might have made a mistake in copying the link.
  2. The image might have been removed from the folder you uploaded on.
    If you are sure about the above two points then the most probable reason is that,
  3. Your organization has blocked the https images on your email. In this case you can co-ordinate with your internal services team or follow the below Microsoft blog for resolution.
    The Linked image cannot be displayed error - Outlook | Microsoft Learn
  4. Get the https images allowed for your organization and you will start receiving the email with the recent made changes. 

Conclusion

Concluding, we can use different html tags to enhance the alert triggers that are being initiated from SuccessFactors. With a little tweaking and understanding of html tags we can actually cater the business requirements that can standout.
